element.name: name_prefix
element.label: Stanza Name Prefix
element.key: This field is optional , but if you need to setup multiple destination names that have the same queue/topic name, you can prefix the destination name with a string identifier, the stanza name that will get persisted to inputs.conf will then be in the format jms://destType/prefix:destination , else it will be in the format jms://destType/destination

element.name: name
element.label: JMS Topic or Queue name to index messages from
element.key: Name of the queue or topic
form_data.get('dest_type') + "/" + form_data.get('name_prefix') + ":" + value

element.name: init_mode
element.label: Initialisation Mode
element.key: Initialise connection objects via JNDI or Local instantiation.

element.name: jndi_init_options
element.key: JNDI Initialisation Mode Settings

element.name: jms_connection_factory_name
element.label: JMS Connection Factory JNDI Name
element.key: Ensure any required jars are in the $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/apps/jms_ta/bin/lib directory

element.name: jndi_initialcontext_factory
element.label: JNDI Initial Context Factory Name
element.key: Ensure any required jars are in the $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/apps/jms_ta/bin/lib directory

element.name: jndi_provider_url
element.label: JNDI Provider URL
element.key: URL to connect to the JNDI Server

element.name: user_jndi_properties
element.label: User defined JNDI properties
element.key: User specific JNDI properties string in format 'key1=value1,key2=value2,key3=value3'

element.name: jndi_user
element.label: JNDI Username
element.key: Username for authenticated JNDI connections

element.name: jndi_pass
element.label: JNDI Password
element.key: Password for authenticated JNDI connections

element.name: local_init_options
element.key: Local Initialisation Mode Settings

element.name: local_init_mode_resource_factory_impl
element.label: Implementation class for local JMS resource instantiation
element.key: An implementation of the com.splunk.modinput.jms.LocalJMSResourceFactory interface.Ensure that the necessary jars are in the $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/apps/jms_ta/bin/lib directory

element.name: local_init_mode_resource_factory_params
element.label: Implementation parameter string for local JMS resource instantiation
element.key: Parameter string in format 'key1=value1,key2=value2,key3=value3'. This gets passed to the implementation class to process

element.name: destination_user
element.label: Topic/Queue Username
element.key: Username for the topic/queue if required

element.name: destination_pass
element.label: Topic/Queue Password
element.key: Password for the topic/queue if required

element.name: common_options
element.key: Topic and Queue Common Settings

element.name: message_selector
element.label: Message Selector
element.key: Only messages whose header and property values match the selector are delivered.For syntax details , refer to http://docs.oracle.com/javaee/5/api/javax/jms/Message.html

element.name: index_message_properties
element.label: Index message property values ?
element.key: Message body is always indexed.Optionally you can index the message property values.False by default.

element.name: index_message_header
element.label: Index message header fields ?
element.key: Message body is always indexed.Optionally you can index the message header fields.False by default.

element.name: strip_newlines
element.label: Strip newline characters from message body ?
element.key: Message body is always indexed.Optionally you can index the message header fields.False by default.

element.name: message_handler_impl
element.label: Implementation class for a custom message handler
element.key: An implementation of the com.splunk.modinput.jms.AbstractMessageHandler class.You would provide this if you required some custom handling/formatting of the messages you consume.Ensure that the necessary jars are in the $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/apps/jms_ta/bin/lib directory

element.name: message_handler_params
element.label: Implementation parameter string for the custom message handler
element.key: Parameter string in format 'key1=value1,key2=value2,key3=value3'. This gets passed to the implementation class to process.

element.name: jvm_system_properties
element.label: Custom JVM System Properties
element.key: Properties string in format 'sysprop1=value1,sysprop2=value2,sysprop3=value3'. Note : these JVM System Properties will apply to the entire JVM context and all stanzas you have setup

element.name: topic_options
element.key: Additional Topic Settings

element.name: durable
element.label: Durable Message Consumption ?
element.key: If this is a topic you can specify the message consumer to be durable

element.name: client_id
element.label: Client ID
element.key: Specify a unique client id.This is used for durable topic subscription

element.name: queue_options
element.key: Additional Queue Settings

element.name: browse_queue_only
element.label: Only browse queues ?
element.key: If connecting to a queue , only browse the queue and don't consume messages.

element.name: browse_mode
element.label: Browse Mode
element.key: Choose how you want to browse the queue, just output stats or dump all the messages.

element.name: browse_frequency
element.label: Browse frequency(secs)
element.key: If in queue browsing mode, specify the frequency at which to poll.Enter '-1' for constant browsing.

element.name: sourcetypeFields
spl-ctrl_sourcetypeSelect
element.label: Set sourcetype
element.key: [[ e for e in ['sourcetype'] if form_defaults.get(e) ][0]]
[[ e for e in ['sourcetype'] if form_defaults.get(e) ][0]]

element.name: sourcetype
element.label: Source type
element.key: If this field is left blank, the default value of script will be used for the source type.
_('script') if (value==None or value=='') else value
form_data.get('spl-ctrl_from_list') if form_data.get('spl-ctrl_sourcetypeSelect')=='spl-ctrl_from_list' else value if form_data.get('spl-ctrl_sourcetypeSelect')=='sourcetype' else None
form_data.get('spl-ctrl_from_list') if form_data.get('spl-ctrl_sourcetypeSelect')=='spl-ctrl_from_list' else value if form_data.get('spl-ctrl_sourcetypeSelect')=='sourcetype' else None
Source type

element.name: spl-ctrl_from_list
element.label: Select source type from list
element.key: Splunk classifies all common data types automatically, but if you're looking for something specific, you can find more source types in the Splunkbase apps browser or online at www.splunkbase.com.
Source type
Set sourcetype field for all events from this source.

element.name: hostFields
element.key: Host

element.name: indexField
element.key: Index
Set the destination index for this source.

element.name: eai:acl.app
element.label: App
element.key: entity['eai:acl']['app'] or ""
